intro: Cineraria vallis-pacis, commonly known as the Peace Valley cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue or violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Cineraria vallis-pacis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
